intro: Gomphia semiserrata, commonly known as the serrated gomphia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Restionaceae and is characterized by its tufted, grass-like appearance. The plant produces small, white or pale blue flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in coastal and sandy environments, often growing in open, sunny habitats. Gomphia semiserrata is adapted to withstand salt spray and is an important component of coastal vegetation.
